items.title: The rise of on-demand leadership in the AI economy
items.description: Companies are favoring experienced consultants over permanent roles as judgment becomes more valuable than execution.

items.title: Trump finds a ‘solution’ to Greenland crisis, backs off on 10% tariff threats
items.description: Trump has repeatedly said that anything less than controlling all of Greenland is "unacceptable."

items.title: The Walmart C-suite reshuffle shows how the retailer sees itself now: as a tech company
items.description: The retail giant is bolstering its tech cred with a focus on AI and e-commerce, and a major appointment.

items.title: Why Coinbase split with Andreessen Horowitz and the crypto industry on a key bill—and what’s next for the Clarity Act
items.description: CEO Brian Armstrong’s move to pull support for a Clarity Act draft risks alienating key political allies.

items.title: Trump says Europe does one thing right: drug prices. ‘A pill that costs $10 in London costs $130 in New York or Los Angeles’
items.description: The president called out French President Emmanuel Macron on refusing to raise drug prices, and claimed tariff threats make Macron change his mind.
